abstract.text: How to create services, change the configuration and important type aliases.
How to get a list of available software and the actual software version
How to connect to viDoc and interact with the device on a low level.
The messages received from viDoc and related model types.
How to discover and connect to Ntrip mountpoints.
How to receive coordinate and accuracy data from viDoc.
How to access and communicate with the laser module in viDoc.
How to read the iOS device’s surroundings and combine with GPS information.
How to record single points with increased accuracy.
How to decipher where and why VigramSDK failed.

inlineContent.text: VigramSDK is a library to connect your app to viDoc to retrieve location data and perform laser distance recordings.

content.text: What is the new on release

inlineContent.text: VigramSDK supports both Cocoapods and Swift Package Manager.

Make sure to add your GitLab account credentials to Xcode before attempting to add the package.

SinglePointRecordingService can be used to record single points over a given duration.
During the recording phase, the service will keep track of all the environment’s data and then merge individual measurements to one combined single point.

Peripheral provides a write and receive interface to communicate with the viDoc device.
NtripConnectionInformation combines all connection data needed to connect to an NTRIP server besides the necessary mountpoint.

NtripService is used to search for NTRIP mountpoints for various NTRIP providers and create
instances to access NTRIP data.
SinglePointRecordingError are thrown, when due to the filtering phase of single point recordings there is not enough valid data to create a singlePoint.
A SinglePoint is the result of a single point recording, where a certain position is recorded over a given duration.
